channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Public Affairs Events
channel.desc: Public affairs events, congressional hearings, speeches, and interviews.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Key Capitol Hill Hearings
channel.desc: Hearings, speeches and political coverage from around the United States.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Public Affairs Events
channel.desc: Public affairs events, congressional hearings, speeches, and interviews.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Key Capitol Hill Hearings
channel.desc: Hearings, speeches and political coverage from around the United States.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Researchers Discuss Absenteeism in Schools
channel.desc: Researchers discuss the causes, effects and patterns of students regularly being absent from school; the American Enterprise Institute hosts this forum in Washington, D.C.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Education Secretary Testifies on Trump's 2026 Budget Request
channel.desc: Education Secretary Linda McMahon testifies on President Trump's 2026 budget request for her department.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Scholar Speaks About Being Detained by Trump Admin
channel.desc: Georgetown scholar Badar Khan Suri speaks at Busboys and Poets restaurant in Washington, DC. He was arrested and detained by ICE in March, and accused of spreading Hamas propaganda, and was released in May upon a federal judge's order.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Public Affairs Events
channel.desc: Public affairs events, congressional hearings, speeches, and interviews.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Jos? Andr?s, Change the Recipe
channel.desc: Chef Jos Andrs talks about the life lessons he's learned through the work he does with the World Central Kitchen, an organization that feeds people in conflict and disaster zones around the world.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Daniel Samet, U.S. Defense Policy Toward Israel
channel.desc: Ronald Reagan Institute fellow Daniel Samet discusses U.S. military policy toward Israel during the Cold War, which he says is dominated by U.S. strategic interests.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: After Words
channel.desc: In an interview with The Federalist's culture editor Emily Jahshinksy, Emory University professor Mark Bauerlein argues that the lack of general civics knowledge by millennials poses a threat to America's political and social institutions.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Gerald Horne, Armed Struggle?
channel.desc: Prof. Gerald Horne of University of Houston talks about the Black Liberation Movement in Southern Calif. and its turn towards armed struggle during the 1960s and 1970s.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Judy Karofsky, DisElderly Conduct
channel.desc: Former Middleton, Wisconsin, Mayor Judy Karofsky takes a critical look at the business of assisted living and hospice care in America.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Corinna Lain, Secrets of the Killing State
channel.desc: Corinna Lain of University of Richmond School of Law takes a critical look at the use of lethal injection as a method of capital punishment; she argues that the reality of this form of execution is more brutal than is widely understood.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Vauhini Vara, Searches - Selfhood in the Digital Age
channel.desc: Journalist Vauhini Vara describes her experience with AI tools like ChatGPT, and the future of artificial intelligence; McNally Jackson Books in New York City hosts this event.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Q & A
channel.desc: Jason Riley, author of "The Affirmative Action Myth," argues that the racial preference policies of the 1960s and 1970s have had an overall negative impact on the success of Black Americans.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Long Island Histories
channel.desc: Book TV presents coverage of the Gold Coast Book fair in Oyster Bay, N.Y.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Casey Burgat & Steve Israel, We Hold These Truths
channel.desc: Book TV presents coverage of the 2025 Gold Coast Book Fair in Oyster Bay, N.Y.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Russell Shorto, Taking Manhattan
channel.desc: Book TV presents coverage of the 2025 Gaithersburg Book Festival in Maryland.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Thomas Maier, The Invisible Spy
channel.desc: Investigative reporter Thomas Maier profiles former NFL football player and World War II spy Ernest Cuneo, and his connection to British Prime Minister Winston Churchill's New York-based spy ring during the war.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Book Publishing CEO Roundtable
channel.desc: Simon and Schuster CEO Jonathan Karp and Hachette Book Group CEO David Shelley discuss how they guide their companies through a period of rapid change in the book industry.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Jos? Andr?s, Change the Recipe

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Thomas Maier, The Invisible Spy
channel.desc: Investigative reporter Thomas Maier profiles former NFL football player and World War II spy Ernest Cuneo, and his connection to British Prime Minister Winston Churchill's New York-based spy ring during the war.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Book Publishing CEO Roundtable
channel.desc: Simon and Schuster CEO Jonathan Karp and Hachette Book Group CEO David Shelley discuss how they guide their companies through a period of rapid change in the book industry.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Lectures in History
channel.desc: Sonia Gomez discusses the intimate relationships between people of different racial and ethnic backgrounds in Hawaii and Japan during and immediately after World War II.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Reel America
channel.desc: Defining jazz by looking critically at white America and arguing that the music form could only have been invented by Blacks as an expression of African American life.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: The Presidency
channel.desc: Historic speeches of former U.S. presidents as well as their policies and legacies.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Reel America
channel.desc: This 1984 National Institute of Justice video shows dramatized scenarios of police search and seizure and critiques the legality of techniques.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Q & A
channel.desc: Reginald Dwayne Betts discusses King's jail letter's impact on him in prison and his post-release life, including founding Freedom Reads to build prison libraries.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Q & A
channel.desc: Former Newsweek editor and managing editor of CNN Worldwide, Mark Whitaker, author of The Afterlife of Malcolm X, discusses the life and legacy of the Black nationalist leader, who was assassinated in 1965.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: The Presidency
channel.desc: Historic speeches of former U.S. presidents as well as their policies and legacies.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: The Civil War
channel.desc: Author Melissa Klapper discusses the diary of Jewish American Emma Mordecai who lived in the South before and during the Civil War.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: U.S. Senate
channel.desc: A highlight from a recent Senate session.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: History of Tariffs
channel.desc: Professors Douglas Irwin, Sharon Ann Murphy and Eric Rauchway discuss how the federal government historically has implemented tariffs and how they have impacted the economy.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Edward Dolnick, Dinosaurs at the Dinner Party
channel.desc: Author Edward Dolnick talks about the early 19th century paleontologists who discovered fossils, huge bones and coined the term dinosaur.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Reel America
channel.desc: This report on the January 1968 activities of President Lyndon B. Johnson includes his State of the Union address, North Korea's seizure of the naval surveillance ship USS Pueblo, and the Tet Offensive in Vietnam.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Teaching African American History
channel.desc: Linda Salley, teacher and President and Executive Director of the African American Museum of Bucks County, Pennsylvania, discusses the importance of teaching African American history.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture Centennial
channel.desc: Simon and Schuster, CEO Jonathan Karp and Hachette Book Group CEO David Shelly discuss how they are guiding their companies through a period of rapid change in the book industry.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Reel America
channel.desc: This 1986 U.S. Patent and Trademark Office film, hosted by actor Ossie Davis, highlights the work of minority inventors and the patents they hold.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Martha Blanding & Tim O'Day, Groundbreaking Magic
channel.desc: Martha Blanding breaks a color barrier at California's Disneyland, becoming the park's first black official tour guide in 1971, joining the high ranks among Disney cast members as employees are known.
